column3: @MarcoFalke: thanks. Added mentioning in the `validateaddress` help.\n
I think this conflicts with key origin which is for better or worse being used in the wild.\n
Can you please fix the comment above? You are sending 11 BTC but the comment says 21 BTC.\n

Not sure about this one but I feel we could create a fresh rpc-test/hd-wallet.py or wallet-hd.py, as I expect the hd functionality will be extended further.

In the future it would be easier to extend the hd test if it was a separate file and we wouldn't need to fiddle with the already bloated wallet.py

Yes. As soon as we have an bip32 import function (start a wallet with given xpriv) this makes sense. Without that, it's hard to cover the new hd features in tests. For this little change I guess it would be an overkill to start the a new test-script.\n

I think it is wrong to use `wallet.py` to test HD behavior. Instead, we should set `-usehd=0` for the wallet tests and create a separate file for HD test. Otherwise, the legacy wallet is completely untested.\n
Please rebase on #8309 when merged and move this check over to the other test script.\n
